item.title: Report X-2025031265
item.description:
Report X-2025031265

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-27T15:24:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-18
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT RC-1 SINGULATOR, BELT TENDER NOTICED HAZMAT PACKAGE HAD A WET SPOT ALL OVER HALF OF THE BOTTOM PORTION. BELT TENDER NOTIFIED RMP THROUGH THE RADIO ABOUT THE HAZMAT PACKAGE AND RMP NOTIFIED DESIGNATED RESPONDER. DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED AT RC-1 SINGULATOR WITH THEIR SPILL CART, FULL PPE ON, AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. DESIGNATED RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED THE CURRENT DECISION TREE, WHICH LEAD TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET SINCE THERE WAS A FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL. SINCE THERE WAS NO PUDDLE UNDERNEATH PACKAGE, NO ZEP ZORBENT WAS NEEDED. DESIGNATED RESPONDER CONTAINED FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE AND RETURNS BACK TO THE PSC CAGE. DESIGNATED RESPONDER STARTED PROCESSING THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE. AFTER PUTTING THE SOLIDIFIED CONTENTS AND CONTAMINATED CARDBOARD IN GREEN BAGS, DESIGNATED RESPONDER DECONTAMINATED THEIR PPE USED FROM THE RESPONSE.

item.title: Report E-2025030266
item.description:
Report E-2025030266

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-25T18:19:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-21
  • City: WHEELING
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 21, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1990 was punctured and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. The crew patched the drum and overpacked it in one (1) 95-gallon drum. HCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site and collected all waste in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025030796
item.description:
Report X-2025030796

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-18
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS ROCKFORD, ILLINOIS FACILITY, ONE AIR PACKAGE BROKE OPEN REVEALING DANGEROUS GOODS CONTENTS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWELVE LITHIUM-ION BATTERY PACKS AND FOUR HILTI POWER TOOLS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY FLOWN IAH TO RFD. THIS PACKAGE WAS DROPPED OFF IN BEAUMONT, TEXAS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 78R07Y, SUNBELT RENTALS, 1799 INNOVATION PT, FORT HILL SC 29715-4556.
